intro: Cochleariopsis groenlandica subsp. arctica, commonly known as the Arctic cochlearia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, basal leaves. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it blooms during the short summer season. This subspecies is an important component of the tundra ecosystem, providing food for various herbivores.
